text: it was kind of like the perfect fire
when you just don't know who you are
anymore the phoenix from the ashes was
meeting Margie after the fire I had just
lost my home and my studio and all my
work to a terrible of IRC the driveway
here and this was my studio it was just
Roble my life's work all my photographs
and paintings all my negatives it's all
desk now mm-hmm I had seen the house
that had burned down and I really could
I really got a good sense of who Susan
must have been by that house mosaic on
the side of the house and her driveway
was painted multiple colors I mean that
the house that burned down was a
masterpiece but I didn't know her I just
knew the house I needed everything from
spoons to a couch and I went online and
ordered everything every day there were
packages arriving and Margie was working
for fedex at the time my heart just went
out to her they're all she had lost
especially knowing that she was an
artist very often she would come to the
door in the morning and I'd be sitting
in the kitchen crying
I just tried to bring as much love as I
could to this total stranger Margie
would spend her 10-minute breaks with me
and even though we only had a few
minutes together she made me feel like I
wasn't alone when we first found this
house we fell in love with the backyard
it hadn't been landscape very much but
what we saw with the blank canvas
I would not have met Marj if it hadn't
been for the fire it's quite funny that
I was Susan's FedEx person thank
goodness for the packages yeah
